head.title: Metro Business; Daily News to Start Free Evening Paper

hedline.hl1: Metro Business; Daily News to Start Free Evening Paper

abstract.p: Daily News will begin distributing free evening newspaper aimed at commuters starting Sept 12; executives say new paper will be called Daily News Express (S)

block.p: The Daily News will begin distributing a free evening newspaper aimed at commuters starting Sept. 12, executives said yesterday.
The new paper, to be called The Daily News Express, will have a staff of about 12 reporters and will generally feature 20 pages of news and 20 pages of advertisements.
The Daily News will begin distributing a free evening newspaper aimed at commuters starting Sept. 12, executives said yesterday.
The new paper, to be called The Daily News Express, will have a staff of about 12 reporters and will generally feature 20 pages of news and 20 pages of advertisements.

Street hawkers will hand out the paper at 75 transportation points in Manhattan and downtown Brooklyn Mondays through Fridays, between 4 and 7 p.m. It will not publish on weekends. The Express will have an initial press run of 75,000.
Les Goodstein, The Daily News's president, said the new paper would focus on business coverage and late-breaking general news. ''This is an abbreviated, quick read,'' he said.
This is not the newspaper's first foray into an evening publication. In 1980 it started a paper called Tonight, but shut it down after about a year because of lagging sales.
